Params: {3: 'It\'s been quite some time since that weird "post-war syndrome" incident.'}
{1: '1', 3: "Everyone seems to know how you caused trouble at the Star of Life because you were too worried about your members' safety. Even colleagues occasionally tease you about it."}
{3: 'Everything seems to be back to normal.'}
{3: 'Many see this as a sign that "Reclaiming the Homeland" is going well. This should\'ve been something worth celebrating... It should\'ve...'}
{3: 'The only tension is the elusive, obscure sensation. It happened uninvited on an unremarkable day and has since taken up stayed in the heart.'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Star of Life Doctor', 3: "...These are very clear symptoms of overexertion. The test shows no other problems, so I won't give you any meds. Rest is the most effective. Take some time off, if you can.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The Star of Life doctor continuously scrolls through the test reports on the screen, offering reassurance.'}
{3: 'Still tasting the lingering shadow lurking in my heart, I can only give the doctor a short response.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'After the test results came out, friends who learned of my condition sent kind messages. Soon, many asked to meet up.'}
{3: 'You wake up on a rare afternoon with no missions and daze for a long while.'}
{3: "You open the calendar and memo to see Ayla's name written under a circled date."}
{3: 'The dome stands magnificent, the reliefs solemn. Inside the elegantly decorated opera house, every seat is filled.'}
{3: 'On the side door of the main hall are posters of recent productions—classic operas from both before and after the Golden Age:\\n"Euridice", "Orfeo", "L\'incoronazione di Poppea", etc.'}
{3: 'And in the center is tonight\'s main: "The Tale of the Gray Raven".'}
{3: 'Rhythmic verses and lyrics resonate in the hall.'}
{1: '"Blood-red and blinding, shadows coil and creep, and malice drips with hungry teeth."', 3: '40'}
{3: '"Blood-red and blinding, shadows coil and creep, and malice drips with hungry teeth."'}
{1: '"Gunsmoke burns the air and scattered shots grow rare. The Area of Defense hangs by a thread."', 3: '40'}
{3: '"Gunsmoke burns the air and scattered shots grow rare. The Area of Defense hangs by a thread."'}
{3: "As the music continues, the performers' gestures grow increasingly bold."}
{3: 'You are lost in the music, but sense sudden movement beside you.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Ayla sits beside you, leaning over slightly. She whispers to you without taking her eyes off the stage.'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: '"You" are about to go on stage.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'I specifically asked the prop master and director to make "You" stand out more.', 4: '18'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Before you can finish speaking, the stage lights suddenly overlap, illuminating performers who were in the shadows.'}
{2: 'Commandant', 3: "Fear not, and don't worry, the Gray Ravens are here.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Commandant', 3: 'Eliminate the enemy, rescue our allies, and advance at full speed.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'As the "Commandant" dances on stage, all characters twirl around them, pushing the story toward its climax.'}
{3: 'You let out a soft laugh, as a mixture of mild embarrassment and vague memories wash over you.'}
{3: "You can't quite remember all the details, but the people you met along the way remain vivid in your memory."}
{3: 'You pause as the actors, who are wearing familiar makeup but not-quite-accurate costumes, exit the stage.'}
{3: 'The rousing scene ends, with only one person remaining next to the character known as "Commandant".'}
{3: 'She stands in the spotlight, pouring her emotions to the audience and seemingly also to her lover behind her.'}
{3: 'The moment she speaks, the surrounding noise gently fades. Sounds become distant and ethereal as the stage seems to move closer.'}
{3: "The actress's beautiful, flowing lyrics warp and distort this surreal experience. It first grates on your nerves, then suddenly becomes clear and focused."}
{3: 'Then, it changes into a completely unfamiliar voice, a clear and crisp sound filled with emotion.'}
{3: "Your smile that just appeared fades. A subtle tremor and anxiety run through your body, like you've missed something important."}
{3: 'In a daze, the lead actress seems to change before your eyes. Her face becomes blurred, yet somehow you can still see her elegant beauty.'}
{3: 'Everything else disappears, as if only two people remain in this world.'}
{2: '???', 3: '"My lover shall be young forever in my poetry."'}
{1: '1', 3: "Your thoughts are interrupted as an external force forcibly turns your head. You see Ayla's worried expression."}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Are you okay? What happened? You look terrible.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "If you're not feeling well, let's leave.", 4: '1'}
{3: "You gently take Ayla's hand and lower it, mumbling incoherent words as your feelings are too jumbled. Your look back at the stage."}
{2: 'Actress', 3: 'Ah, my dear Gray Raven Commandant, I shall...'}
{3: 'The performance continues. Everything on stage is going smoothly as if what just happened was an illusion.'}
{3: 'Outside the opera house, the cold wind hits your face, clearing your mind.'}
{3: 'The afterimage of your hallucination during the performance is fading, leaving behind an uncomfortable void.'}
{3: 'Your emotional dissonance remains despite the doctor\'s advice. Instead, "it" sits in the void, nodding in acknowledgment.'}
{3: 'You respond with a soft sigh as fatigue sets in.'}
{3: 'You stop at the doorstep, pinch the bridge of your nose, slowly crouch down, and let out a long exhale.'}
{3: 'You take the drink and scoot over. Ayla sits down beside you.'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Sorry, was the script bad? Did the lines make you feel uncomfortable?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "Several scriptwriters are Gray Raven fans. They've always wanted to tell your story, but there are too many confidentiality restrictions.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "Oh! Those two lines are actually quotes from a famous author's work!", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Ayla laughs as she springs to her feet, moving with light, graceful steps.'}
{3: 'She closes her eyes, her body swaying with the wind as she dances, finally extending her right hand gracefully before her.'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'My lover shall be young forever in my... poetry...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Before I can join in with her impromptu performance, Ayla abruptly stops with furrowed brows in deep thought.'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "I'm fine, Commandant. It's just that I... just had a strange feeling just now...", 4: '1'}
{2: "Because that doesn't sound like something you would say.", 3: '222'}
{2: 'Something like "you will remain forever young in my paintings" would be more appropriate?', 3: '223'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Haha... that sounds like something you would say in a dangerous situation.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'My response helps Ayla shake her hesitation, and she laughs softly.'}
{3: 'Ayla steps back and makes a camera gesture at you with her hands with one eye closed.'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "Hm, that doesn't sound too bad, you know. If you don't mind, 【kuroname】, you should quit your job and become my model!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Hmm... how about loads of free tickets to musicals and art exhibitions every month?', 4: '1'}
{2: "I don't have that much time off work anyway.", 3: '236'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "Oh come on, humor me! Don't you think musicals and art exhibitions are awesome? Wasn't there anything about tonight's performance that moved you?", 4: '1'}
{3: "Ayla's question brings back the discomfort that was almost undetectable in our casual exchange. That strange feeling waves at you, asserting its presence."}
{3: 'You try to recall that brief image, but it has already faded, leaving only vague unease.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Hmm? Do you like her? Or did you only enjoy her poetry recitation? I can get you an autograph if you want.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Neither. I think I mistook her for someone else.', 3: '261'}
{2: 'I just wanted to know more about the character she was playing.', 3: '262'}
{2: "I don't seem to have anyone like that in my life.", 3: '263'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Ah, she was playing a fictional character.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'In the play, the heroic protagonist needs comrades to fight together, and also needs someone who understands them...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Hehe... They actually asked for my opinion, worried they might offend you.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "I told them as long as they don't make specific references, 【kuroname】 wouldn't mind having a character.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Ayla blinks playfully, her smile clears much of the lingering melancholy in the air.'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "It's a shame, really. I wanted to take you to a different performance, but that script had been indefinitely suspended for some reason.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'By the time I heard it was approved, a performance group was already rehearsing it. Sadly, their schedule never seemed to match your breaks...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'No. Musical theater is quite different from acrobatic performances, though this play does revolve around war.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Ayla clears her throat and changes her tone.'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "An impressive battle it was, my brave comrades! But the fight is yet over, for our land is corrupted still, I'm afraid.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'So stand! Stand! Behind you your homeland you shall guard and defend!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "Stand! Stand! Skybound our home intends, stop us this bitter earth shan't!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "Don't worry, scripts with themes like this go through very strict review processes.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "The WGAA understands that war and suffering are serious topics and should not be used for fame and fortune. They've always been extremely cautious.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Before it was suspended, "The Acadia Evacuation" actually received extremely high praise.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "The author's plot design was incredibly intricate, using many clever devices to convey their understanding of The Acadia Evacuation as a historical event.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "Though it might differ from history, it's certainly a good story nonetheless.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Oh, then... so what exactly was it suspended?', 3: '310'}
{3: "Ayla freezes at the question. She can't seem to decide if she should speak."}
{3: 'Ayla smiles with a furrowed brow, then finally shrugs to dismiss the thought entirely.'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'I feel like I should remember... No, I definitely heard about it, but it was probably just a rumor.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "Or I wouldn't have this strong feeling that I know about it, even though I can't remember the details.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'As Ayla speaks, she turns her head to look behind her.'}
{3: 'Following her gesture, you turn around to see several posters at the opera house entrance.\\n"The Acadia Evacuation" grabs your attention.'}
{3: 'On the poster, a young girl stands with her back to the viewer, hands clasped in prayer amidst ruins.'}
{3: 'Gazing from a distance, a fleeting thought enters your mind.'}
{2: '(Who would create a work like this?)', 3: '333'}
{3: 'Abess Research Institute, 8:30, Unknown Area, Line Spacing: 1.'}
{3: 'A cold voice echoes among the rubble.'}
{3: 'A disheveled figure lies trapped between broken stones among the ruins.'}
{3: 'The voice pierces through her foggy consciousness as Iris struggles to move her body.'}
{3: 'She crawls to her feet and looks toward the voice. She finds a device between the scattered fragments of what looks like an armor.'}
{3: 'Iris murmurs as her stalled systems restart, struggling to maintain the functionality of her damaged frame.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Enora Lueya', 3: 'Such affection. If I were there, I would do everything I could to respond.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Enora Lueya', 3: "Our long standoff is finally giving a result. You've stopped me so many times, but this time I managed to stay one step ahead.", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Enora Lueya', 3: 'The first act, titled <color=#ff4e4eff>Abess</color>, has ended.', 4: '18'}
{3: 'The hostile voice from the device also sounds sincere.'}
{2: 'Enora Lueya', 3: "Give up. I don't want to hurt you. This tug-of-war is pointless except a waste of our time.", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Enora Lueya', 3: "The play that's meant to be performed will eventually be staged. The past cannot be changed.", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Enora Lueya', 3: 'I can make countless tries, but you only need to fail once for everything to end up like this research institute.', 4: '18'}
{3: 'Iris looks around. Among the rubble, blood-stained clothing is vaguely visible. Her tired voice carries a hint of sorrow.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Iris', 3: "...You're right. I can't always get here in time to stop you.", 4: '1'}
{3: "But she doesn't stop. She walks toward the communication device, with each step becoming more confident."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Enora Lueya', 3: '...Why do you insist on continuing when you already understand the situation?', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Enora Lueya', 3: "What's the point of tiring yourself out and sacrificing yourself? Is a choice like that even worth anything?", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Enora Lueya', 3: "Or... maybe you want to escalate this conflict and draw in targets that weren't originally part of my plan?", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Iris', 3: 'No, Lueya. Abess was the first and will be the last.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Iris walks to the communication device. She places her hand on the core of her chest, gently sweeping across it. A brilliant blue light emerges.'}
{3: 'The radiance turns into lines, creating a pattern in the void. As the light fades, a musical instrument materializes in its place.'}
{3: 'Iris sits casually on the ruins as music rises from the instrument.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Enora Lueya', 3: "It's useless. Whatever you're relying on, it will eventually...", 4: '18'}
{3: 'You suddenly hear discordant notes and a strange distortion spreads out from Iris.'}
{3: 'It spreads so fast that it seems to cross space and time before reaching the other end.'}
{3: "Iris freezes after hearing Lueya's astonished reaction."}
{3: 'She takes a few light breaths to calm herself, then slowly raises her head to speak.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Iris', 3: "No matter how hard the conductor and I try, even if we stop you, we can't revert the damage caused by the battle's aftermath.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Iris', 3: 'But what if we use a different stage? What if we use a... completely isolated stage? Whatever you do on there, no audience will be harmed.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Enora Lueya', 3: "You can't do that! You can't even catch my true form, let alone...?!", 4: '18'}
{3: 'The voice falls silent after realizing the problem.'}
{2: 'Iris', 3: 'Yes, we did have trouble locating you before, but now...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Iris', 3: 'You destroyed the Abess Research Institute, altering a critical node... The world was hurt, and it remembers you now.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Iris', 3: "Listen to my new piece. For the next performance, it'll be just you and me.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Iris' voice interrupts Enora Lueya's low growl. Something changes as the musical notes resonate through the air."}
{3: 'She tilts her head to gaze at the moon through gaps in the ruined building.'}
{3: 'The moonlight and the sky freeze for a moment as her notes reach them, as if asking a question.'}
{3: "Iris lowers her eyelids, answering the world's question in her heart."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Iris', 3: 'Because even a flower wants to shield the one it cherishes from wind and rain... Conductor has been through enough.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Iris', 3: "A story that can end behind the scenes shouldn't be brought to light. Since the ending is already fixed...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'These words end the chat and you set the terminal aside.'}
{3: 'You grab dinner with several colleagues after parting with Ayla. You talk until late into the night before going back to the dorm.'}
{3: "The table is covered with gifts, including several brought on behalf of friends who couldn't attend."}
{3: 'You feel happy reading through the letters that came with the gifts. Paper is better at transmitting sentiments than electronic data.'}
{3: 'You carefully label each letter so you can put them in the mail cabinet, but, as soon as the cabinet door opens, a pile of letters falls out.'}
{3: 'You bend down to pick them up and see your name as the recipient on all of them. All the wax seals are broken.'}
{3: 'You pause for a moment before opening one letter. The creased paper inside is completely blank.'}
{3: 'Only the stamp of the WGAA rests quietly in one corner of the paper.'}
{3: 'Feeling puzzled, you open the cabinet door again to check the label. This space is definitely for incoming mail, not outgoing.'}
{2: 'Why are there so many blank letters here?', 3: '490'}
{2: "And they all look like they've been opened and read...", 3: '491'}
{3: 'After thinking, you decide to put the letters back in a neat pile.'}
{3: 'But the thought brings a strong sense of discomfort, as if a voice deep down is sounding an alarm.'}
{3: 'After thinking, you decide to put the letters back in a neat pile.'}
{3: 'You take out fresh writing paper the moment you close the cabinet.'}
{3: 'Your motion is fluid, as if closing the mail cabinet and writing a reply to someone is a habit, instinct, a natural consequence of countless repetitions.'}
{3: 'But as pen meets paper, discomfort makes your hand freeze. Even though you already know the opening lines and just need to write them down.'}
{1: 'It should express well-wishes, because the recipient is always wandering.', 2: '000000ff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1207.jpg', 6: '1', 7: '1'}

{1: "It should share amusing stories from tonight's musical performance, because the recipient enjoys discussing such things and always has insights to offer.", 2: '000000ff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1207.jpg', 6: '1', 7: '1'}
{3: 'The bizarre dissonance rises once more. "It" crouches beside your ear, gazing silently at you.'}
{3: '"It" is trying to remind you that this isn\'t bewilderment. This isn\'t a daze, and certainly not confusion, but—'}
{3: 'Your gaze falls to the edge of the paper, where the WGAA\'s stamp enters your vision. Logic fades as the poster of "The Acadia Evacuation" abruptly jumps into mind.'}
{3: 'Suddenly, "it" departs, leaving behind a barely noticeable sound in your ear—something between a soft sigh and mocking laughter.'}
{3: 'Shaking your head to dispel the discomfort, you open your terminal as you ponder each word.'}
{1: 'The musical was fascinating, I really enjoyed it, too...', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 9: '1'}
{3: 'After writing out all your thoughts on the evening, you hesitate before adding one more line.'}

{1: 'I wonder when "The Acadia Evacuation" we talked about today will be released. If it\'s convenient for you, let\'s watch it together.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 7: '-1'}

{1: "I still have a bit of free time left. Before returning to duty, I'd like to have a meal with you.", 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 7: '-1', 9: '1'}
{1: 'Time does not flow in cycles for humans. It flows in a straight line.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 7: '1', 10: '1'}
{1: 'This is why humans can never find happiness.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 7: '1', 10: '1'}
{1: 'Because happiness is the longing for repetition.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 9: '1', 10: '1'}
